referrals.intro: Take care of yourself!  Your local clinic is here to help with any health problems. If you need extra support, here are some free helplines:
Seeing or going through violence can be scary and confusing.  But there are people who can help you and your child!
Feeling sad, stressed, or having trouble with your child's behaviour?  These places can help:

Family life can be tough!  Did you know that social workers at your local Department of Social Development can help with parenting skills, fatherhood, teenage pregnancy, and family or relationship counselling? If there isnt a DSD office near you, NGOs in your area offer this support too.
A lot of our energy goes into helping the person struggling with substance abuse. While thats important, you and your family need support too!  Find help for everyone below:
Legal and SASSA issues can be stressful and confusing!  There may be more support available than you realise at the organisations below:
Understanding sexual and gender development can be confusing and hard to talk about.  Were all unique! Heres some support and guidance:

safeguarding_help_data.msg: I might know some resources that can help.

I hope this was helpful! You can access this information at any time by typing {HELP}.
